`supplyac=$(cat $homeuser/komodo/src/assetchains | grep $1 | cut -d ' ' -f3)
                                rewardhere=$(cat $homeuser/komodo/src/assetchains | grep $1 | cut -d ' ' -f4)
                                if [ ! "$rewardhere" == "" ]

                                else
                                        reward=" "
                                fi                                                                                                     
                                processname="$komodo_binary_name -ac_name=$1"
                                processcli="$komodo_cli -ac_name=$1"
                                processmincount=1
                                processargs="-pubkey=$pubkey -ac_supply=$supplyac -addnode=$seed_ip $reward"
                                processpath="$komodo_binary_dir"
                                processlaunch="$processname $processargs"
                                processaddress="$kmdaddress"
                                notarysize='0.0001'
                                statssize='0.00083600'
                                debugpath="$homeuser.komodo/$1/debug.log"
                                ntrzaddr="RXL3YXG2ceaB6C5hfJcN4fvmLH2C34knhA"
                                autosplitnumber=100
                                autosplitname=$1
                                autosplitvalue=10000
                                externalcoin="no"
`

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
that was the idea, people using `src/assetchains` will still work, people who want to write simple scripts can use `src/assetchainparams` and loop over the output, people who want to write complex scripts can use the JSON directly.

Only the JSON needs to be updated and everything else will inherit the changes.

I hadn't accounted for people parsing the bash source though üòÜ

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: for those who don't want to use python, I'm doing a basic func to get 1) all the AC list. 2) return the whole params parsed from json when you input (manually or not) the AC name

Content: (yes, I'm a dinosaur)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <dragonrider-e:matrix.org> great!

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: assuming that even the dpowassets could be in the future modified to use the json, I believe that's an alternative way to do

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
`#!/bin/bash
delay=0
listallac=$(cat luke2.json | jq -r .[].ac_name)
echo "$listallac" > listallac

getparamsofac() {

if [ -z "$1" ] || [ "$(cat /home/dwy/script/listallac | grep $1 | wc -l)" -eq 0 ]
then
        echo "Please input AC NAME"
else
        thiskeys=$(cat luke2.json | jq -r ".[] | select(.ac_name==\"$1\")" | jq -r 'keys[]')
        totalparams=""
        coinacname=" -ac_name=$1"
        while read thisk; do
                if [ ! "$thisk" == "ac_name" ]
                then
                        thisparam=$(cat luke2.json | jq -r ".[] | select(.ac_name==\"$1\").$thisk")
                        totalparams+=$(echo " -$thisk=$thisparam")
                fi
        done <<< "$thiskeys"
fi
}

launchac() {
while read line; do
        getparamsofac $line
        echo "komodo-cli $coinacname $totalparams"
        sleep $delay
done <<< "$listallac"
}

getparamsofac RFOX

getparamsofac AAA

getparamsofac

launchac
`
